segments.pli: “Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā anekavihitaṃ attānaṃ samanupassamānā samanupassanti, sabbete pañcupādānakkhandhe samanupassanti, etesaṃ vā aññataraṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, whatever ascetics and brahmins regard various kinds of things as self, all regard the five grasping aggregates, or one of them.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, assutavā puthujjano ariyānaṃ adassāvī ariyadhammassa akovido ariyadhamme avinīto, sappurisānaṃ adassāvī sappurisadhammassa akovido sappurisadhamme avinīto
segments.en: It’s when an uneducated ordinary person has not seen the noble ones, and is neither skilled nor trained in the teaching of the noble ones. They’ve not seen good persons, and are neither skilled nor trained in the teaching of the good persons.

segments.pli: rūpaṃ attato samanupassati, rūpavantaṃ vā attānaṃ; attani vā rūpaṃ, rūpasmiṃ vā attānaṃ.
segments.en: They regard form as self, self as having form, form in self, or self in form.

segments.pli: viññāṇaṃ attato samanupassati, viññāṇavantaṃ vā attānaṃ; attani vā viññāṇaṃ, viññāṇasmiṃ vā attānaṃ.
segments.en: consciousness as self, self as having consciousness, consciousness in self, or self in consciousness.

segments.pli: Iti ayañceva samanupassanā ‘asmī’ti cassa avigataṃ hoti.
segments.en: So they’re not rid of this way of regarding things and the conceit ‘I am’.

segments.pli: ‘Asmī’ti kho pana, bhikkhave, avigate pañcannaṃ indriyānaṃ avakkanti hoti—
segments.en: As long as they’re not rid of the conceit ‘I am’, the five faculties are conceived—
the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.

segments.pli: Atthi, bhikkhave, mano, atthi dhammā, atthi avijjādhātu.
segments.en: The mind, thoughts, and the element of ignorance are all present.

segments.pli: Avijjāsamphassajena, bhikkhave, vedayitena phuṭṭhassa assutavato puthujjanassa ‘asmī’tipissa hoti;
segments.en: Struck by feelings born of contact with ignorance, an uneducated ordinary person thinks ‘I am’,
‘I will be neither percipient nor non-percipient’.
The five faculties stay right where they are.

segments.pli: Athettha sutavato ariyasāvakassa avijjā pahīyati, vijjā uppajjati.
segments.en: But an educated noble disciple gives up ignorance about them and gives rise to knowledge.
With the fading away of ignorance and the arising of knowledge, they don’t think ‘I am’,
‘I will be neither percipient nor non-percipient’.”

suttaplex.blurb: When you identify anything as self, you always identify one or other of the five aggregates.
